guidelines.title: Set Up Development Environment
guidelines.description: The guideline likely includes instructions on how to set up the development environment to ensure that developers can start contributing to the project quickly and efficiently.

guidelines.title: Code Style Adherence
guidelines.description: This guideline emphasizes the importance of following the project's coding standards and styles, ensuring consistency and readability across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Developers are usually asked to report bugs, feature requests, or other issues via the project's issue tracker, often with specific information to help maintainers understand and address the problem.

guidelines.title: Pull Request Process
guidelines.description: Guidelines for submitting pull requests, which likely include steps such as forking the repository, creating a feature branch, making commits, and submitting the pull request for review.

guidelines.title: Writing Tests
guidelines.description: A guideline recommending or requiring developers to write tests for the new features or bug fixes they implement, ensuring that changes are properly validated.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Reminds contributors to update the documentation in tandem with code changes to maintain comprehensive and accurate project documentation.

guidelines.title: Commit Message Format
guidelines.description: The guideline often specifies a preferred format for commit messages to keep commit histories clear and useful, aiding in better project management and code review.

guidelines.title: Review and Approval
guidelines.description: This guideline describes the process of code review and approval, detailing how contributions are reviewed by maintainers or other contributors before being merged.

guidelines.title: Community Conduct
guidelines.description: Outlines acceptable behavior within the community, including how contributors should collaborate respectfully and constructively.
